item.title: youtube-dl repository restored at GitHub
item.description: The GitHub repository for the youtube-dl utility, which is used to download video content from various web sites (including YouTube, thus the name), has been restored. As we reported in last week's edition, GitHub had taken the repository down due to a DMCA notice from the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA). The only change made to youtube-dl is the removal of some tests that downloaded a few seconds of certain music videos; those videos were specifically targeted by the RIAA in its complaint.
item.author: ([Posted November 16, 2020 by jake])

item.title: Blazor WebAssembly : Google Authentication - EP15
item.description:
Hey Coders, Subscribe here - https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCetyodKOWGk5H6FoKoFnkZw Talk to us on - https://www.twitch.tv/curiousdrive
Like our page - https://www.facebook.com/curiousdrive/ Follow us on - https://twitter.com/curious_drive Follow us on - https://www.instagram.com/curiousdrive/
Make a donation - https://www.paypal.me/curiousdrive Be a member - https://www.patreon.com/curiousdrive GitHub - https://github.com/CuriousDrive/BlazingChat
Facebook Developer's Portal - https://console.developers.google.com/
Terms and Feed - https://www.termsfeed.com/
Facebook Authentication Nuget Package - https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.Google
In this episode of #Blazor WebAssembly, I am going through steps to show how you can use integrate #Google#Authentication
Topics that we are going to over - 1. Creating Google App on it's Developer Portal 2. Using TermsFeed.com to generate Privacy Policy and Terms and Conditions 3. Add API key and API Key Secret in the AppSettings.json 4. Install nuget package Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.Google 5. Add Google Authentication support in the StartUp.cs 6. Add GoogleSignIn Web API call in the Controller 7. Add Google Login Button to call the Web API
#CuriousDrive #WeLoveCoding
item.author: (Curious Drive)

item.title: Why does my command line redirection echo with an extra 1? Who's inserting these rogue 1s everywhere? | The Old New Thing
item.description: If you leave echo enabled in your batch file, and the batch file executes a command with redirection, then a mysterious 1 is inserted. C:> copy con %TEMP% est.cmd dir >nul ^Z 1 file(s) copied. C:> %TEMP% est.cmd C:> dir 1>nul ⇑ 🤨 The rogue 1 appears to be a purely visual glitch.
item.author: (Raymond Chen Follow)

item.title: Exploring How Computers Work
item.description:
A little exploration of some of the fundamentals of how computers work. Logic gates, binary, two's complement; all that good stuff!
I see there’s some interest in getting access to the little simulation tool I made. It’s not in a very user friendly state at the moment, but I’ll see about polishing it up and releasing it for free sometime soon!
If you'd like to support the creation of more videos, I'd greatly appreciate your support here: https://www.patreon.com/SebastianLague
Learning Resources: https://www.coursera.org/learn/build-a-computer https://www.youtube.com/c/BenEater
Chapters: 00:00 Intro 00:50 Logic Gates 03:09 The Simulation 05:06 Binary Numeral System 06:16 Binary Addition Theory 07:24 Building an Adder 12:11 Negative Numbers Theory 15:08 Building the ALU 17:43 Outro
Music: "A New Perspective " by Ryan Smart "Beyond the Horizon" by Sounds Like Sander "Crystal Bursts" by Cody Martin "Air" by Assaf Ayalon "Elastic Vibe" by Ziv Moran "Gotcha!" by Avocado Junkie
Images: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vacuum_tube#/media/File:8863-Project-Whirlwind-CRMI.JPG
item.author: (Sebastian Lague)

item.title: Ask Jamie: Configuration, Infrastructure, and DevOps • Jamie Phillips
item.description: I am working through the next set of questions that I received on Twitter related to DevOps. I will have the questions and my response. Config As Code vs. Infrastructure As Code When is something in a deployment considered infrastructure vs configuration? — Mötz Jensen (@splaxi) October 30, 2020 Here are my thoughts on that topic. In my opinion, infrastructure is what your application needs to run vs. configuration is how it needs to run.

item.title: DevOps and Ransomware
item.description: Mr. Bezos. I’m all in favor of a clean fulfillment center, but tell me: Why do you sweep? Why do you not instead eliminate the source of dirt? - Unknown “insultant” Does DevOps pass the “so what?” test? When you start to follow the history of DevOps from Agile, Lean, TOS, TQM, TPS, and beyond; doesn’t it lead to plain old critical thinking? Is it anything special? If it’s so simple, if anyone can do it, then why on earth would the worlds richest person pay an “insultant” to teach him?
item.author: (Eric Alexander)
